revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Jim Belushi | image = File:JamesBelushi.jpg | caption = Belushi in May 2007 | birth_name = James Adam Belushi | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1954|6|15}} | birth_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]], [[United States|U.S.]] | death_date = | residence = [[Brentwood, Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S. | other_names = James Belushi, "The Belush", Zee Blues | alma_mater = [[Southern Illinois University Carbondale|Southern Illinois University]] | occupation = [[Actor]], [[Voice acting|voice actor]], [[comedian]], [[Singing|singer]], [[musician]] | years_active = 1977–present | spouse = {{marriage|Sandra Davenport|1980|1988|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|[[Marjorie Bransfield]]|1990|1992|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|Jennifer Sloan|1998|2018|reason=sep.}} | children = 3; including [[Robert Belushi]] | relations = [[John Belushi]] (brother)
Billy Belushi (brother)
Marian Belushi Miles (sister) | website = {{url|jimbelushi.ws}} }} '''James Adam Belushi''' ({{IPAc-en|b|ə|ˈ|l|uː|ʃ|i}}; born June 15, 1954) is an Albanian-American actor, voice actor, comedian, singer and musician.{{cite web| url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/jim-belushi/157017/|title= Jim Belushi| publisher= [[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] | accessdate= July 7, 2016}} He is the younger brother of comic actor [[John Belushi]]. He is the father of actor [[Robert Belushi]]. He played the role of Jim on the sitcom ''[[According to Jim]]'' (2001–2009). His other television roles include ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' (1983–1985), ''[[Wild Palms]]'' (1993), ''[[Aaahh!!! Real Monsters]]'' (1994–1997), ''[[Show Me a Hero]]'' (2015) and ''[[Twin Peaks (2017 TV series)|Twin Peaks]]'' (2017). Belushi has appeared in films such as ''[[Thief (film)|Thief]]'' (1981), ''[[Trading Places]]'' (1983), ''[[About Last Night (1986 film)|About Last Night]]'' (1986), ''[[Salvador (film)|Salvador]]'' (1986), ''[[Red Heat]]'' (1988), ''[[K-9 (film)|K-9]]'' (1989), ''[[Mr. Destiny]]'' (1990), ''[[Curly Sue]]'' (1991), ''[[Jingle All the Way]]'' (1996), ''[[Underdog (film)|Underdog]]'' (2007) and ''[[The Ghost Writer (film)|The Ghost Writer]]'' (2010). ==Early life== Belushi was born in Chicago, to Adam Anastos Belushi, an [[Albanians|Albanian]] from the city of [[Korçë]], in Albania,{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogy.com/ftm/m/a/h/Denny-Mahoney/WEBSITE-0001/UHP-0528.html|title=Denny-Mahoney - User Trees - Genealogy.com|website=www.genealogy.com|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} and Agnes Demetri (Samaras) Belushi, who was the daughter of [[Albanians]] from Korçë.{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogy.com/ftm/m/a/h/Denny-Mahoney/WEBSITE-0001/UHP-1342.html|title=Denny-Mahoney - User Trees - Genealogy.com|website=www.genealogy.com|accessdate=June 15, 2017}} He was raised in [[Wheaton, Illinois|Wheaton]], a Chicago suburb, along with his three siblings: older brother [[John Belushi|John]], older sister Marian, and younger brother Billy.{{cite web|url=http://www.genealogy.com/ftm/m/a/h/Denny-Mahoney/WEBSITE-0001/UHP-0531.html|title=Denny-Mahoney - User Trees - Genealogy.com|publisher=}} After graduating from [[Wheaton Warrenville South High School|Wheaton Central High School]], Jim Belushi attended the [[College of DuPage]] and graduated from [[Southern Illinois University Carbondale]] with a degree in Speech and Theater Arts. ==Career== [[File:Belushi.jpg|thumb|left|Belushi at the [[39th Venice International Film Festival]] in 1982]] From 1977 to 1980, Belushi, like his older brother [[John Belushi]], worked with the Chicago theater group [[The Second City]]. During this period, Belushi made his television debut in [[1978-79 United States network television schedule|1978]]'s ''[[Who's Watching the Kids]]'' and also had a small part in [[Brian De Palma]]'s ''[[The Fury (1978 film)|The Fury]]''. His first significant role was in [[Michael Mann (film director)|Michael Mann]]'s ''[[Thief (film)|Thief]]'' (1981). After his elder brother John's death, [[History of Saturday Night Live (1980-1985)|from 1983 to 1985]] he appeared on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''; he portrayed characters such as Hank Rippy from "Hello, Trudy!" and "That White Guy". Belushi also appeared in the film ''[[Trading Places]]'' as a drunk man in a gorilla suit during a New Year's Eve party. He made a guest appearance in [[Faerie Tale Theatre]]'s third-season episode ''Pinocchio'', starring [[Paul Reubens]] as the titular puppet. Belushi rose to greater prominence with his supporting roles in ''[[The Man with One Red Shoe]]'' (1985), ''[[About Last Night...]]'', ''[[Salvador (film)|Salvador]]'' and ''[[Little Shop of Horrors (film)|Little Shop of Horrors]]'' (as Patrick Martin) (all 1986), which opened up opportunities for lead roles. He has starred in films including ''[[Real Men (film)|Real Men]]'', ''[[The Principal]]'', ''[[Red Heat]]'', ''[[Homer and Eddie]]'', ''[[K-9 (film)|K-9]]'', ''[[Dimenticare Palermo]]'', ''[[Taking Care of Business (film)|Taking Care of Business]]'', ''[[Mr. Destiny]]'', ''[[Only the Lonely (film)|Only the Lonely]]'', ''[[Curly Sue]]'', ''[[Once Upon A Crime]]'', ''[[Wild Palms]]'', ''Royce'', ''[[Race the Sun]]'', ''[[Jingle All The Way]]'', ''[[Separate Lives (1995 film)|Separate Lives]]'', ''[[Retroactive (film)|Retroactive]]'', ''[[Gang Related (film)|Gang Related]]'', ''[[Angel's Dance]]'' and ''[[Joe Somebody]]'' (2001). His voice work includes ''[[Mighty Ducks (TV series)|The Mighty Ducks]]'', ''[[The Pebble and the Penguin]]'', ''[[Babes in Toyland (1997 film)|Babes in Toy land]]'', ''[[Gargoyles (TV series)|Gargoyles]]'' and ''[[Hey Arnold!]]'', and the more recent ''[[Hoodwinked]]'', ''[[Scooby-Doo! and the Goblin King]]'' and ''[[The Wild]]''. He also lent his vocal talents for ''[[9: The Last Resort]]'' (a [[personal computer|PC]] game released in 1995), in which he portrayed "Salty", a coarse yet helpful character. In 1997, he portrayed the "Masked Mutant" in the Goosebumps PC video game, alongside [[Adam West]] as "The Galloping Gazelle". On January 4, 2001, Belushi appeared on the ''[[ER (TV series)|ER]]'' episode "[[ER (season 7)|Piece of Mind]]". The episode focused on both [[Dr. Mark Greene]]'s life-or-death [[brain surgery]] in New York and Belushi's character, who had been in a car accident with his son in Chicago. Belushi's performance contributed to his re-emergence in the public eye, and the following year he was cast as the title role in ABC's ''[[According to Jim]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.biography.com/people/james-belushi-20851499#recent-years |title=Jim Belushi stars as suburban father in According to Jim |last= |first= |date= |website=[[Biography.com]] |access-date=August 23, 2016}} His first animation voice-over was as a pimple on Krum's head in ''[[Aaahh!!! Real Monsters]]'' on [[Nickelodeon]]. That performance led him to be cast in the continuing role as Simon the Monster Hunter in that series, where he ad-libbed much of his own dialogue. [[File:Nunez and Belushi.jpg|thumb|Belushi in [[House of Blues]] in [[Houston]], 2008]] In 2003, Belushi and [[Dan Aykroyd]] released the album ''Have Love, Will Travel'', and participated in an accompanying tour. The concert was made available on [[video on demand]] by [[Bob Gold & Associates]].{{cite news|title=Charter drives VOD with Aykroyd-Belushi video|url=http://www.cedmagazine.com/news/2003/10/charter-drives-vod-with-aykroyd-belushi-video|accessdate=30 January 2015|publisher=CED|date=2003-10-13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150206223540/http://www.cedmagazine.com/news/2003/10/charter-drives-vod-with-aykroyd-belushi-video|archive-date=2015-02-06|dead-url=no|df=}}{{cite news|last1=Song|first1=David|title=Charter Unveils First MSO-Produced Video-on-Demand Original Program|url=http://ir.charter.com/phoenix.zhtml?c=112298&p=irol-newsArticle&ID=457958&highlight=|accessdate=26 January 2015|publisher=Charter Communications}} He also performs at various venues nationwide as Zee Blues in an updated version of [[The Blues Brothers]]. He released his first book, ''Real Men Don't Apologize'', in May 2006. Recently, Belushi was a narrator of an [[NFL]] offensive linemen [[Advertising|commercial]]. Belushi also introduced the starting lineups for the [[University of Illinois]] [[football team]] during [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]]'s telecast of the 2008 Rose Bowl. He appeared in [[MC Hammer]]'s video "[[Too Legit to Quit (song)|Too Legit to Quit]]" in 1991 (in the extended full-length version). He also hosted a celebration rally for the [[Chicago Cubs]] playoff series in Chicago prior to the [[2008 World Series]]. Steve Dahl has dubbed him "The Funniest Living Belushi." In 2010, Belushi was cast in a [[pilot episode|pilot]] for [[CBS]] called ''[[The Defenders (2010 TV series)|The Defenders]]'' a series about defense lawyers. The one-hour series premiered on September 22, 2010.{{cite news|url=http://www.cbs6albany.com/articles/defenders-1278426-cbs-connell.html |title='The Defenders' stars Jerry O'Connell, Jim Belushi chat with CBS 6 |work=[[WRGB]] |date=September 16, 2010 |accessdate=February 20, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110708124832/http://www.cbs6albany.com/articles/defenders-1278426-cbs-connell.html |archivedate=July 8, 2011 |df= }} In two episodes in 2011, Belushi was paired with Blues Brothers partner [[Dan Aykroyd]].{{cite web|url= http://www.tvguide.com/News/Dan-Aykroyd-Defenders-1026196.aspx |title= Dan Aykroyd to Reunite with Jim Belushi on The Defenders|publisher=TVGuide.com|accessdate=November 30, 2010}}{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2011/02/17/AR2011021706507.html|title=TV Highlights: Dan Aykroyd on 'The Defenders'; Dina Lohan on '20/20'; 'Gold Rush: Alaska' finale|work=The Washington Post |date=February 18, 2011|accessdate=February 20, 2011}} On May 15, 2011, ''The Defenders'' was canceled by CBS.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/15/the-defenders-s-my-dad-says-and-mad-love-canceled-by-cbs/92704/ |title=The Defenders Cancelled by CBS; $#*! My Dad Says Cancelled by CBS; Mad Love Cancelled by CBS – Ratings | TVbytheNumbers |publisher=Tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com |date=May 15, 2011 |accessdate=September 4, 2012}} In 2011, he was cast as corrupt businessman Harry Brock in ''[[Born Yesterday (play)|Born Yesterday]]'', which opened on [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] in late April.{{cite web|title=Born Yesterday, Starring Jim Belushi and Nina Arianda, Sets Dates at Broadway's Cort Theatre|url=http://www.broadway.com/shows/born-yesterday/buzz/155038/born-yesterday-starring-jim-belushi-and-nina-arianda-sets-dates-at-broadways-cort-theatre/|publisher=Broadway.com}} ==Personal life== Belushi has been married three times and has three children. He married Sandra Davenport on May 17, 1980, and the couple had a son, [[Robert Belushi|Robert James]] (also an actor, born October 23, 1980), they divorced in 1988.https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jim-belushis-wife-files-for-divorce/ Belushi was married to actress [[Marjorie Bransfield]] from 1990 to 1992.https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/jim-belushis-wife-files-for-divorce/ He has been married to Jennifer Sloan since May 2, 1998, the couple have a daughter, Jamison Bess (born July 28, 1999) and a son, Jared James (born February 8, 2002).https://www.people.com/tv/jim-belushi-wife-jennifer-sloan-files-divorce/amp/ On March 5, 2018 Jennifer Sloan filed for [[divorce]].https://www.people.com/tv/jim-belushi-wife-jennifer-sloan-files-divorce/amp/ Belushi is closely linked to his Albanian heritage and received honorary Albanian citizenship from the [[President of Albania]], [[Bamir Topi]]. Belushi is an avid fan of the [[Chicago Blackhawks]], [[Chicago Bears]], [[Chicago Cubs]], [[Chicago Bulls]] and the [[Chicago Fire Soccer Club]].{{cite web|title=Jim Belushi loves his teams—and his haters|work=RedEye Chicago|url=http://articles.redeyechicago.com/2013-09-25/sports/42400371_1_bears-da-coach-movie |accessdate=September 25, 2013}} In 2011, Belushi announced that he suffered from [[gout]], and became a spokesman for [[Savient Pharmaceuticals]]' educational campaign "Check Out Your Gout".{{Cite press release|url=http://www.wfsb.com/story/15974596/savient-pharmaceuticals-and-jim-belushi-launch-check-out-your-gout-educational-campaign |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130209110221/http://www.wfsb.com/story/15974596/savient-pharmaceuticals-and-jim-belushi-launch-check-out-your-gout-educational-campaign |dead-url=yes |archive-date=February 9, 2013 |title=Savient Pharmaceuticals and Jim Belushi Launch 'Check Out Your Gout' Educational Campaign |date=November 7, 2011 |publisher=Savient Pharmaceuticals }}{{cite web |url=http://www.foxnews.com/health/2012/12/04/king-comedy-jim-belushi-speaks-out-about-gout.html |title='King of comedy' Jim Belushi speaks out about gout |last1=Dougherty |first1=Christopher |date=December 6, 2012 |website=FoxNews.com |publisher=Fox News Network, LLC |access-date=March 7, 2016 |quote=Belushi found relief from his gout by taking the medicine allopurinol, which eliminated his high levels of uric acid. However, for people suffering from RCG, conventional treatment such as this may be ineffective. Belushi has partnered with the website http://checkoutyourgout.com/ in hopes of sending a message to gout sufferers that they don’t have to live in pain.}} He has also appeared on the cover of and been interviewed by ''[[Cigar Aficionado]]'' magazine.Rhodes, Joe (March 1, 1994). [http://www.cigaraficionado.com/webfeatures/show/id/7776 "Jim Belushi's Big Year"]. ''[[Cigar Aficionado]]''. Belushi endorsed the re-election campaign of [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] President [[Barack Obama]] in 2012. On a [[Fox News]] interview, he explained "When you talk to the President in private, he's a cool guy, who knows what he's doing. Besides, I'm from Chicago too." {{cite news| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/16/obama-west-coast-trip-california-fundraising_n_1281329.html | work=Huffington Post | title=Obama Courts Campaign Donors on West Coast | date=February 16, 2012}} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#B0C4DE;" ! Year ! Title ! Trudy!'') * Man on the Street Jesse Donnelly * That White Guy, a stereotypical Caucasian man who can rap ===Celebrity impersonations=== * [[Rosemary Clooney]] * [[Joe Cocker]] * [[Joan Collins]] *
